dividend.translation[0].definitions[1].d: prize money offered in a national competition called the football pools which people can win by correctly guessing the results of football games
dividend.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a number that is to be divided by another number
dividend.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a part of the profits of a company for a particular period of time that is paid to shareholders for each share that they own
dividend.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The group raised its regular dividend on common shares 19% to 25 cents.
Consolidated Press forecasts a dividend of 29.8 cents a share.
dividend.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a fixed rate of interest that is paid on certain types of company STOCK
dividend.translation[1].definitions[1].e: If Ford common stock remains depressed, they will still collect an 8.4% dividend on the preferred stock.
dividend.translation[1].definitions[2].d: a part of the profits of a LIFE INSURANCE company paid out to those who have insurance agreements with the company
dividend.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Holders of some types of policies, such as whole life, may see increases in their dividends.
dividend.translation[1].definitions[3].d: to decide not to pay a dividend, usually because of bad financial results
dividend.translation[1].definitions[3].e: Poor profitability forced the Japanese airline to pass its dividend for the sixth year running.
The board voted to omit the dividend.
